translated: Vaidya
The Perfection of Wisdom Sutra of Kauśika.
Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas!
Thus have I heard.

original: ekasmin samaye bhagavān rājagṛhe viharati sma gṛdhrakūṭe parvate mahatā bhikṣusaṃghena sārdhamanekaiśca bodhisattvaśatasahasraiḥ sarvaiḥ kumārabhūtaiḥ
analyzed: ekasmin samaye bhagavān rājagṛhe viharati sma gṛdhrakūṭe parvate mahatā bhikṣu saṃghena sārdham anekaiḥ ca bodhisattva śata sahasraiḥ sarvaiḥ kumāra bhūtaiḥ
translated: At one time the Blessed One was dwelling in Rājagṛha on the Vulture Peak mountain together with a great assembly of monks and many hundreds of thousands of bodhisattvas, all of whom were youthful.

original: tatra khalu bhagavān śakraṃ devānāmindramāmantrayate sma //
analyzed: tatra khalu bhagavān śakram devānām indram āmantrayate sma
translated: There the Blessed One addressed Śakra, Lord of the Gods:🔽Kauśika, this is the meaning of the perfection of wisdom. The perfection of wisdom should not be seen as dual or non-dual.🔽Not as having signs or signless.🔽Not as accumulated or dispersed.🔽Not as exalted or not exalted.

original: ayaṃ kauśika prajñāpāramitāyāḥ arthaḥ prajñāpāramitā na dvayena draṣṭavyā na advayena /🔽na nimittato na animittataḥ /
analyzed: ayam kauśika prajñāpāramitāyāḥ arthaḥ prajñāpāramitā na dvayena draṣṭavyā na advayena  na nimittataḥ na animittataḥ
translated: Not as defiled or undefiled.🔽Not as purified or unpurified.🔽Not as abandoned or not abandoned.🔽Not as based or not based.🔽Not as connected or unconnected.

original: na āyūhato na nirāyūhataḥ /🔽notkṣepato na prakṣepataḥ /
analyzed: na āyūhataḥ na nirāyūhataḥ  na utkṣepataḥ na prakṣepataḥ
translated: Not as conditioned or unconditioned.🔽Not as a cause or not a cause.🔽Not as an effect or not an effect.🔽Not as an entity or non-entity.🔽Not as existent or non-existent.
Not as grasped or not grasped.🔽Not as an object of knowledge or not an object of knowledge.🔽Not as an object of mind or not an object of mind.

Not as an object of thought or not an object of thought.🔽Not as an object of consciousness or not an object of consciousness.🔽Not as an object of the eye or not an object of the eye.🔽Not as an object of the ear or not an object of the ear.

original: notsargato na anutsargataḥ /🔽na sthānato na asthānataḥ /
analyzed: na utsargataḥ na an utsargataḥ  na sthānataḥ na asthānataḥ
translated: Not as an object of the nose or not an object of the nose.🔽Not as an object of the tongue or not an object of the tongue.🔽Not as an object of the body or not an object of the body.🔽Not as an object of form or not an object of form.
Not as an object of sound or not an object of sound.🔽Not as an object of smell or not an object of smell.🔽Not as an object of taste or not an object of taste.
Not as an object of touch or not an object of touch.🔽Not as an object of dharmas or not an object of dharmas.🔽Not as an object of the eye element or not an object of the eye element.
Not as an object of the form element or not an object of the form element.🔽Not as an object of the eye consciousness
Not from Dharma, not from non-Dharma.
Not from thusness,
not from not thusness,
not from the reality limit, not from the unreal limit should it be known.

analyzed: evam eva ayam sa kauśika prajñāpāramitāyāḥ arthaḥ
translated: Thus indeed, Kauśika, is the meaning of this perfection of wisdom.

original: tadyathā sarvadharmasamatvāt prajñāpāramitā samā /🔽sarvadharmaviviktatvāt prajñāpāramitā viviktā /
analyzed: tat yathā sarva dharma sama tvāt prajñāpāramitā samā  sarva dharma vivikta tvāt prajñāpāramitā viviktā
translated: Just as the perfection of wisdom is equal because all dharmas are equal,🔽the perfection of wisdom is isolated because all dharmas are isolated,

original: sarvadharmācalatvāt prajñāpāramitā acalā /🔽sarvadharmāmanyatvāt prajñāpāramitā amanyatā /🔽sarvadharmābhīrutvāt prajñāpāramitā abhīru /
analyzed: sarva dharma acala tvāt prajñāpāramitā acalā  sarva dharma a manya tvāt prajñāpāramitā a manya  sarva dharma abhīru tvāt prajñāpāramitā abhīru
translated: the perfection of wisdom is unshakable because all dharmas are unshakable,🔽the perfection of wisdom is without conceit because all dharmas are without conceit,🔽the perfection of wisdom is fearless because all dharmas are fearless,

analyzed: sarva dharma ācchambhita tayā prajñāpāramitā a chambhī
translated: the perfection of wisdom is without fear because all dharmas are without fear,

analyzed: sarva dharma eka rasa tvāt prajñāpāramitā ekarasā  sarva dharma anutpāda tvāt prajñāpāramitā anutpādā
translated: the perfection of wisdom is of one taste because all dharmas are of one taste,🔽the perfection of wisdom is non-arisen because all dharmas are non-arisen,

analyzed: sarva dharma anirodha tvāt prajñāpāramitā anirodhā
translated: the perfection of wisdom is unceasing because all dharmas are unceasing,

analyzed: gagana kalpa tvāt sarva dharmāṇām prajñāpāramitā gagana kalpā
translated: the perfection of wisdom is like space because all dharmas are like space,
the perfection of wisdom is boundless because form is boundless,

analyzed: evam vedanā saṃjñā saṃskāra vijñāna aparyanta tvāt prajñāpāramitā aparyantā
translated: Thus, because feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness are endless, the perfection of wisdom is endless.

analyzed: pṛthivī dhātu aparyanta tvāt prajñāpāramitā aparyantā
translated: Because the earth element is endless, the perfection of wisdom is endless.

original: evamabdhātu tejodhātu vāyudhātu ākāśadhātu vijñānadhātvaparyantatvāt prajñāpāramitā aparyantā /
analyzed: evam ap dhātu tejaḥ dhātu vāyu dhātu ākāśa dhātu vijñāna dhātu aparyanta tvāt prajñāpāramitā aparyantā
translated: Similarly, because the water element, fire element, wind element, space element, and consciousness element are endless, the perfection of wisdom is endless.
Because Mount Sumeru is endless, the perfection of wisdom is endless.
Because the oceans are endless, the perfection of wisdom is endless.
Because of being like a diamond, the perfection of wisdom is equal.

analyzed: sarva dharma abheda tvāt prajñāpāramitā abhedā  sarva dharma svabhāvā
translated: Because of the non-differentiation of all dharmas, the perfection of wisdom is non-differentiated.

analyzed: nupalabdhi tvāt prajñāpāramitā anupalabdhiḥ  sarva dharma vibhāvanā  sama tvāt prajñāpāramitā
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of the nature of all dharmas, the perfection of wisdom is non-apprehensible.

analyzed: vibhāvanā samā  sarva dharma niśceṣṭa tvāt prajñāpāramitā niśceṣṭā
translated: Because of the equality of the illumination of all dharmas, the perfection of wisdom is the illumination of all dharmas.🔽Because of the non-exertion of all dharmas, the perfection of wisdom is non-exertion.

analyzed: sarva dharma acintya tvāt prajñāpāramitā acintyā iti
translated: Because of the inconceivability of all dharmas, the perfection of wisdom is inconceivable.

original: evaṃ dānapāramitā śīlapāramitā kṣāntipāramitā vīryapāramitā dhyānapāramitā prajñāpāramitātrimaṇḍalapariśuddhyaparyantatvāt prajñāpāramitā
analyzed: evam dāna pāramitā śīla pāramitā kṣānti pāramitā vīrya pāramitā dhyāna pāramitā prajñāpāramitā tri maṇḍala pariśuddhi aparyanta tvāt prajñāpāramitā
translated: Thus, the perfection of generosity, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of effort, the perfection of meditation, and the perfection of wisdom are limitless because of the purity of the three spheres. The perfection of wisdom
is limitless.

original: prajñāpāramitā ucyate yaduta aṣṭādaśaśūnyatā /🔽tadyathā ādhyātmaśūnyatā bahirdhāśūnyatā ādhyātmābahirdhāśūnyatā śūnyatāśūnyatā mahāśūnyatā paramārtha🔽śūnyatā saṃskṛtaśūnyatā asaṃskṛtaśūnyatā atyantaśūnyatā anādyagraśūnyatā ana
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā ucyate yat uta aṣṭādaśa śūnyatā  tat yathā ādhyātma śūnyatā bahirdhā śūnyatā ādhyātma abahirdhā śūnyatā śūnyatā aśūnyatā mahāśūnyatā paramārtha  śūnyatā saṃskṛta śūnyatā asaṃskṛta śūnyatā atyanta śūnyatā anādyagra śūnyatā ana
translated: The perfection of wisdom is said to be the eighteen kinds of emptiness.

original: pakāraśūnyatā prakṛtiśūnyatā svalakṣaṇaśūnyatā sarvadharmaśūnyatā anupalambhaśūnyatā abhāvaśūnyatā svabhāvaśūnyatā abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatā iti
analyzed: pakāra śūnyatā prakṛti śūnyatā sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā sarva dharma śūnyatā anupalambha śūnyatā abhāva śūnyatā svabhāva śūnyatā abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā iti
translated: Namely, the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both internal and external phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the great emptiness, the ultimate emptiness, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the infinite, the emptiness of the beginningless and endless, the emptiness of what is not to be discarded, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of specific characteristics, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-existence, the emptiness of inherent existence, and the emptiness of the inherent existence of non-existence.
This is called, in brief, the perfection of wisdom.

original: Kauś / Vaidya tārakā timiraṃ dīpo māyāvaśyāya buddhudam /
analyzed: vaidya tārakā timiram dīpaḥ māyā vaśyāya buddhudam
translated: The stars, eye disease, a lamp, an illusion, dew, a bubble,

original: supinaṃ vidyudabhraṃ ca evaṃ draṣṭavya saṃskṛtamiti //
analyzed: supinam vidyut abhram ca evam draṣṭavya saṃskṛtam iti
translated: a dream, lightning, and a cloud - the conditioned should be seen in this way.
Non-cessation, non-origination, non-annihilation, non-permanence,

analyzed: aneka artham an ānā artham an āgamam anirgamam  yaḥ pratītyasamutpādam prapañca upaśamam śivam
translated: Not one meaning, not many meanings, not coming, not going,🔽He who taught dependent origination, the auspicious pacification of conceptual proliferation,

analyzed: deśayāmāsa saṃbuddhaḥ tam vande vadatām varam
translated: I pay homage to that fully enlightened one, the best of speakers.

original: namo daśasu dikṣu sarveṣāmatītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ trayāṇāṃ ratnānām /
analyzed: namaḥ daśasu dikṣu sarveṣām atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām trayāṇām ratnānām
translated: Homage to all the Three Jewels of the past, future, and present in the ten directions.

original: namo bhagavatyai prajñāpāramitāyai sarvatathāgatasunibhāyai sarvatathāgatānujñātavijñātāyai /🔽oṃ prajñe mahāprajñe prajñāvabhāse prajñālokakāri ajñānavidhamane siddhe susiddhe siddhyamanebha
analyzed: namaḥ bhagavatyai prajñāpāramitāyai sarva tathāgata sunibhāyai sarva tathāgata anujñāta vijñātāyai  om prajñe mahā prajñe prajñā avabhāse prajñā āloka kāri ajñāna vidhamane siddhe susiddhe siddhi amanebha
translated: Homage to the Blessed One, the Perfection of Wisdom, who is like all the Tathagatas, who is approved and known by all the Tathagatas.

Om, to the Blessed One, the glorious one, the greatly glorious one, the one who illuminates wisdom, the one who illuminates wisdom, the one who removes ignorance, the accomplished one, the well-accomplished one, the one who accomplishes all limbs, the beautiful one,

original: ktivatsale prasārahaste samāśvāsakare sidhya sidhya /🔽budhya budhya /
analyzed: kti vatsale prasāra haste samāśvāsa kare sidhya sidhya  budhya budhya
translated: the one who loves devotion, the one with outstretched hands, the one who brings comfort, be accomplished, be accomplished.
Be enlightened, be enlightened.🔽Shake, shake.🔽Move, move.
Roar, roar.
Come, Blessed One, do not delay, svāhā.

analyzed: namaḥ dharmodgatasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahā kāruṇakasya
translated: Homage to the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva, the one with great compassion, Dharmodgata.
Homage to the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: tadyathā munidharme saṃgrahadharme anugrahadharme vimokṣadharme sattvānugrahadharme
analyzed: tat yathā muni dharme saṃgraha dharme anugraha dharme vimokṣa dharme sattva anugraha dharme
translated: As in the Dharma of sages, the Dharma of inclusion, the Dharma of favor, the Dharma of liberation, the Dharma of benefiting beings,

analyzed: vaiśramaṇa dharme samantanu parivartana dharme guṇi graha saṃgraha dharme sarvatra anugata dharme
translated: The Dharma of Vaiśravaṇa, the Dharma of turning everywhere, the Dharma of benefiting the virtuous and the included, the Dharma of pervading everywhere,
The Dharma of being fulfilled at all times, svāhā!
Homage to the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: tat yathā a khane nikhane mukhana nekhane avaravandane
translated: As in akhane nikhane mukhana nekhane avara-vandane
Patane patane patare svāhā!
Homage to the perfection of wisdom.

original: tadyathā gaṅgā gaṅgā na tīrāvabhāsa gaṅgā svāhā //
analyzed: tat yathā gaṅgā gaṅgā na tīra avabhāsa gaṅgā svāhā
translated: As in gaṅgā gaṅgā na tīrāvabhāsa gaṅgā svāhā!
Homage to the perfection of wisdom.

original: tadyathā śrīye śrīye muni śrīye śrīyase svāhā //
analyzed: tat yathā śrīye śrīye muni śrīye śrīyase svāhā
translated: As in śrīye śrīye muni śrīye śrīyase svāhā!
Homage to the perfection of wisdom.
As in oṃ vajra-bala svāhā!
Homage to the perfection of wisdom.

original: tadyathā oṃ hrī śrī dhī śruti smṛti mati gati vijaye svāhā //
analyzed: tat yathā om hrī śrī dhī śruti smṛti mati gati vijaye svāhā
translated: As in oṃ hrīḥ śrī dhī śrutismṛti mati gati vijaye svāhā!
Homage to the perfection of wisdom.

original: tadyathā bambari bambari mahābambari būru būru mahābūru svāhā //
analyzed: tat yathā bambari bambari mahābambari būru būru mahābūru svāhā
translated: As in bambarī bambarī mahā-bambarī būrū būrū mahā-būrū svāhā!
Homage to the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: tadyathā hūte hūte hūvitāśane sarva karmāvaraṇane svāhā
analyzed: tat yathā hūte hūte sarva karma āvaraṇane svāhā
translated: Thus: Hute hute hūvitāśane sarva karmāvaraṇane svāhā.
Homage to the Perfection of Wisdom.
Thus: Oṃ orolik svāhā.
Homage to the Perfection of Wisdom.

analyzed: tat yathā om sarva vid svāhā
translated: Thus: Oṃ sarva-vit svāhā.
Homage to the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: tadyathā gate gate pāragate pārasaṃgate bodhi svāhā //
analyzed: tat yathā gate gate pāra gate pāra saṃgate bodhi svāhā
translated: Thus: Gate gate pāragate pārasaṃgate bodhi svāhā.
The Blessed One said this.

original: āttamanā āyuṣmān sāriputraḥ śakro devānāmindraste ca bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ sā ca sarvāvatī parṣad sadevagandharvamānuṣāsuraśca loko bhagavato
analyzed: ātta manāḥ āyuṣmān sāriputraḥ śakraḥ devānām indraḥ te ca bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ sā ca sarvāvatī parṣad sa deva gandharva mānuṣa asuraḥ ca lokaḥ bhagavataḥ
translated: The Venerable Śāriputra, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, those Bodhisattva Mahāsattvas, and the entire assembly, along with the world with its gods, gandharvas, humans, and asuras,
rejoiced in and praised the Blessed One's
The Perfection of Wisdom named Kauśikā is completed.
